Position Summary The Laboratory Support Technician I is accountable for driving results in a fast-paced environment by assisting the laboratory staff with a wide range of tasks including: laboratory housekeeping, glassware washing, equipment setup and stocking supplies. The position requires superior leadership behaviors of the Alcami core competencies and non-negotiables, as well as expertise in functional competencies included in this position profile. Essential Functions • Removes dirty and/or broken glassware from the lab areas. • Monitors and disposes hazardous waste • Washes and dries glassware and distributes to appropriate locations in the laboratories. • Maintains glass washing areas, keeping them clean and organized. • Sterilizes glassware and other items using an autoclave, if required. • Assists analyst with tasks such as gathering materials, labeling glassware, disposing of solutions, etc. • Ensures all laboratory prepping stations are stocked with supplies. • Ensures lab stations clean, organized, and stocked with supplies. Includes cleaning and water exchange of water baths (sonicators, shakers, and dissolutions). • Performs monthly checks for expired chemicals and reagents and coordinates timely removal of expired materials. • Responsible for the overall inventory management of the laboratory, including purchasing/receiving functions. • This position will be required to supervise, handle, or process hazardous waste under Resource and Conservation guidelines promulgated under 40 CFR 262.177(a)(7), Personnel Training. This includes completion of initial and annual RCRA training and documented as required in Alcami records. This training also includes familiarity with emergency response procedures, emergency equipment, and emergency systems. • Ensures timely completion and compliance with cGMP and all other relevant company training requirements. Education and Experience • High school diploma or equivalent. • Associate’s Degree in Chemistry, Microbiology or related Science discipline, or Bachelor’s degree in not-Science-related discipline is preferred.
